author: Kevin Carter
text:
Some Federal employees make the leap from the national to local level to serve as City Managers, Assistants, or Department Heads. Obviously there are some agencies that lend themselves to preparing future local government leaders, but which ones do you think are the best/most attractive on a potential hire's resume?
(Some ideas)
-Housing and Urban Development (HUD) - Not a great reputation, but works directly on urban planning issues.
-Health and Human Services (HHS) - Maybe a good fit for someone hoping to go into County social services?
-Small Business Administration - Any city manager can tell you how important it is to cultivate good relationships with local businesses.
-Dept. of Transportation - knowledge of transportation infrastructure.
What are your thoughts?
title: What federal department best prepares someone for local govt?
